ptychodactyl.utils¶

These are utility functions that are basically just here to keep the other modules from getting too crowded.

utils.general¶

Some utilitarian functions to help simplify the rest of the modules.

utils.general.fft(image)¶

Performs a fast-fourier transform with correct shifting

utils.general.ifft(image)¶

Performs an inverse fast-fourier transform with correct shifting

utils.general.random(shape, low=0.0, high=1.0)¶

Generate an array of random values within a certain range.

Parameters

  • shape (tuple) – tuple of ints, dimensions of the output array

  • low (float) – lower bound

  • high (float) – upper bound

Returns

array of random values

Return type

np.ndarray

utils.general.shift(arr, shift_amt, crop=None, subpixel=False)¶

Shift an image array by a given amount.

Parameters

  • arr (np.ndarray) – 2D image array that will be shifted

  • shift_amt ((float, float)) – horizontal and vertical shift amount in pixels

  • crop (int) – optional size to crop the shifted image

  • subpixel (bool) – if True, image will be shifted by the exact shift amount using subpixel registration (higher precision). If False, shift amount will be rounded to an integer value (higher speed). Default is False.

Returns

shifted copy of the input array.

Return type

np.ndarray

utils.general.normalize(arr)¶

Project an array onto the range 0 to 1.

Parameters

arr (np.ndarray) – any size array

Returns

normalized array

Return type

np.ndarray

utils.general.calc_error(actual, altered, border=5)¶

Calculate the difference between two complex images. Taken from the ePIE paper (Maiden 2009)

Parameters

  • actual (np.ndarray) – 2D array, the known correct image.

  • altered (np.ndarray) – 2D array, the image for which error is being calculated.

  • border (int) – number of pixels on each edge to ignore when calculating the error.

Returns

an error value

Return type

float

utils.general.demo_binary(size)¶

Generate a complex square image with binary amplitude.

Parameters

size (int) – number of pixels on a side

Returns

2D complex array

Return type

np.ndarray

utils.general.demo_image(size)¶

Generate a complex square image, using one image for the amplitude and another for the phase.

Parameters

size (int) – number of pixels on a side

Returns

2D complex array

Return type

np.ndarray

utils.general.parse_specs(filename)¶

Parses a spec file into a dictionary. Only tested with TXT files.

Parameters

filename (str) – name of the file to parse. Must be in the main directory (3d-ptychography).

Returns

A dictionary containing all the desired parameters as key-value pairs.

Return type

dict
